intro: Palicourea alba, commonly known as white palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Palicourea alba is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its uses.
